subject: Re: [junit] Re: Unit test java documentation
msgSnippet: ... Long test method names with a common prefix means you should consider factor out test fixture . :) J. B. Rainsberger, President, Diaspar Software Services
messageBody:
>So said Dave Astels on 2003-07-01 --------------------
>--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Bob Koss <koss@o...> wrote:
>>
>> I'm curious what kind of comments you add (or documentation you
>> produce). The names of my test methods describe what they do and I
>> never felt the need for any more documenting.
>
>Ya.. me too. I never put comments in my test code... ever... I hardly
>put them in my production code. Keep it clean, keep it clear.
>
>Remeber, long method names are ok... especially in test code.

Long test method names with a common prefix means you should consider "factor out test fixture". :)


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
